intro: Triraphis longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed triraphis, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a serrated margin and a slightly hairy surface. Triraphis longipes is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges.
